titlestmt.titleproper: Philadelphia Museum of Art W. P. Wilstach Collection records 1893-1922
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Philadelphia Museum of Art W. P. Wilstach Collection records

bioghist.p: The W. P. Wilstach Collection of art was bequeathed to the city in 1892 following the probate of Anna H. Wilstach's will. Originally administered by the Commissioners of Fairmount Park and a Wilstach Committee, the PMA acquired custodianship in 1917 when Director Langdon Warner was appointed Curator of the Collection. Currently, the Commissioners continue to administer the collection while custody remains with the Museum.

scopecontent.p: The records comprise correspondence files (1893-1917), presumably of E.A. Shunk, Custodian of Paintings of the Wilstach Gallery, Memorial Hall. Correspondents include Commissioner John G. Johnson, Superintendent Jesse T. Vogdes, Superintendent Russell Thayer, and conservators G.B. Wilkinson and Pasquale Farina. Some of the letters are addressed to Miss Robbins. Materials includes a letterpress volume of outgoing correspondence of Dalton Dorr, Shunk, and Robbins to the Chairman of Committee and Commissioners of Fairmount Park. Correspondence relates to acquisitions, conservation and cleaning of paintings, hanging of paintings in the gallery, and building maintenance such as heating and humidity. Includes lists of holdings and new acquisitions. The collection also includes Hamilton Bell's correspondence related to the Wilstach Collection, largely with M. Knoedler and Company. These letters relate to the restoration and framing of paintings. (1918). Additional materials include clippings about the purchase of Sargent's "Lady Millicent Hawes" (1922), correspondence about the gift of the Sully portrait of William P.C. Barton, and an 1886 catalogue of paintings and works of art belonging to Mrs. A.H. Wilstach.

controlaccess.corpname: Philadelphia Museum of Art. Wilstach Collection.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An online finding aid is available at http://www.philamuseum.org/pma_archives/search.php?c=WIL.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Philadelphia Museum of Art: Fiske Kimball Records, 1908-1955; R. Sturgis Ingersoll Records, 1941-1964
